definition[0]: to make an enemy plane crash to the ground, by firing weapons at it
example[0]: His plane was shot down over France in 1944.
definition[1]: to kill or seriously injure someone by shooting them, especially someone who cannot defend themselves
example[1]: The army were accused of shooting down unarmed demonstrators.
definition[2]: to say or show that someone’s ideas or opinions are wrong or stupid
example[2]: I tried to help, but all my suggestions were shot down in flames, as usual.
definition[3]: to reject something such as a suggestion or offer, or stop it from happening
example[3]: Union members shot down a four-year contract proposal.
